title: Jungle timers showing
body: When the enemy takes Dragon or Baron and we have no vision of it Why do we get a timer. I honestly prefer not getting a timer if we didn't see it go.

replies.body:
because they added that in the new patch.

Reasoning:

>  since these things were easy to track if you just “knew" what to look for, the best way to ‘hide' an objective death was to get everyone off the map and out of enemy vision before you took out the baddie. (you can get timer from dragon sounds and timing from when Baron wore off anyway)

> Two, and this gets more big-picture, we had to ask ourselves what we wanted to be rewarding in taking objectives. There's certainly something to be said about maintaining vision and map control, but that should be on a level playing field as opposed to one team snowballing their previous Dragon / Baron takedown into a serious advantage. Our hope is this will encourage teams to be more proactive about their Barons and Dragons - each time they come up.

Kinda screws over Nunu/Warwick/Fiddle etc who used to be able to sneak the first drag at level 2-4 then basically get the 2nd one too since the enemy didn't have a proper timer.
Well ward dragon Early and they wont steal it or they will steal it but you will have a timer, god summoners should just get some Skill/Knowledge.
